info.name: Invenza API
info.description:
Comprehensive API collection for Invenza Inventory Management System. This collection includes all endpoints for authentication, business management, items, tags, alerts, notifications, sync, and reporting.

Base URL: http://localhost:5000

Authentication: Most endpoints require a Bearer token in the Authorization header.

item.name: Health Check

request.description: Check if the API server is running and healthy. No authentication required.

item.description: Health check endpoint to verify API availability

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Register a new user and create a business. This endpoint creates both a user account and a business entity. The user will be assigned the 'owner' role for the business.

Required fields:
- name: User's full name
- email or phone: At least one is required
- password: Strong password
- businessName: Name of the business
- language: Preferred language (en, am, om)

Note: After registration, verify your email using the verification link sent to your email.

Login with email/phone and password. Returns access token and refresh token.

Required fields:
- email or phone: User's email or phone number
- password: User's password

Response includes:
- accessToken: JWT token for API authentication (expires in 15 minutes)
- refreshToken: Token to refresh access token (expires in 30 days)
- user: User profile information

The access token is automatically saved to collection variables for subsequent requests.

Verify user's email address using the token sent during registration.

The token is sent to the user's email after registration. Copy the token from the email and paste it as a query parameter.

Refresh the access token using the refresh token. Use this when your access token expires (after 15 minutes).

The refresh token is valid for 30 days. After refreshing, both new access token and refresh token are returned.
Logout the user by invalidating the refresh token. After logout, you'll need to login again to get new tokens.

Request a password reset link. An email will be sent with a reset token valid for 15 minutes.

Required fields:
- email: User's registered email address

Reset password using the token received via email.

Required fields:
- token: Token from the password reset email
- newPassword: New strong password

Change password for authenticated user. Requires authentication.

Required fields:
- oldPassword: Current password
- newPassword: New strong password

item.description: Authentication endpoints for user registration, login, password management, and token refresh

item.name: Business

request.description:
Get business details by ID. Supports translation to different languages.

Query parameters:
- lang (optional): Language code (en, am, om) for translating business name and location

No authentication required for this endpoint.

Update business information. Only the business owner can update business details.

Updatable fields:
- name: Business name
- location: Physical location/address
- contactPhone: Contact phone number
- language: Preferred language (en, am, om)

Requires authentication and owner role.

Upload business verification documents (e.g., trade license, tax registration).

Supported formats:
- PDF
- JPEG/JPG
- PNG

Maximum file size: 5MB

Documents are uploaded to Cloudinary and URLs are stored in the business record. Only the business owner can upload documents.

Get business settings including language, contact phone, and verification documents.

Only the business owner can access settings. Requires authentication.

item.description: Business management endpoints for viewing and updating business information

item.name: Items

formdata.description: Unit of measurement: pcs, kg, ltr (default: pcs)

request.description:
Create a new inventory item with optional image upload.

Required fields:
- name: Item name

Optional fields:
- sku: Stock keeping unit
- description: Item description
- quantity: Initial quantity (default: 0)
- unit: pcs, kg, or ltr (default: pcs)
- category: Item category
- location: Storage location
- tags: Array of tag IDs (as JSON string)
- minThreshold: Minimum stock alert threshold
- expiryDate: Expiry date (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- image: Item image file (JPEG/PNG, max 5MB)

If initial quantity > 0, an inventory event is created automatically. If quantity <= minThreshold, a low stock alert is created.

Requires authentication.

List all items for the authenticated user's business.

Query parameters (all optional):
- category: Filter by category
- tag: Filter by tag ID
- lowStock: If 'true', only returns items with quantity <= minThreshold

Returns items sorted by creation date (newest first). Requires authentication.

Get detailed information about a specific item by ID.

Returns complete item details including:
- Basic info (name, SKU, description)
- Quantity and unit
- Category and location
- Tags
- Threshold settings
- Image URL
- Expiry date
- Timestamps

Requires authentication.

Update an existing item. All fields are optional - only include fields you want to update.

Note: To update quantity, use the 'Adjust Quantity' endpoint instead.

Updatable fields:
- name, sku, description
- unit, category, location
- tags (replaces all tags)
- minThreshold
- expiryDate
- image (uploads new image)

Requires authentication.

Adjust item quantity (add or remove stock). This creates an inventory event and checks for low stock alerts.

Required fields:
- delta: Quantity change (positive for additions, negative for removals)
- action: Type of adjustment (added, sold, used, adjusted)

Optional fields:
- reason: Reason for adjustment

Action types:
- added: Stock added (restocking)
- sold: Item sold to customer
- used: Item used internally
- adjusted: Manual quantity adjustment

The system:
1. Updates item quantity
2. Creates an inventory event log
3. Checks threshold and creates alerts if needed
4. Prevents negative quantities

Requires authentication.

Scan an NFC/RFID tag to retrieve associated item information.

Required fields:
- tagId: The scanned tag ID

Returns:
- Tag information
- Associated item details (if tag is attached to an item)
- Message if tag is not attached to any item

Useful for quick item lookup using NFC/RFID scanners. Requires authentication.

Get the complete history of inventory events for a specific item.

Returns a list of all quantity adjustments including:
- Delta (quantity change)
- Action (added, sold, used, adjusted)
- Reason
- Timestamp
- User who performed the action

Events are sorted by timestamp (newest first). Requires authentication.

item.description: Inventory item management endpoints for creating, updating, and tracking items

item.name: Tags

request.description:
Register a new NFC/RFID tag in the system.

Required fields:
- type: Tag type (item or box)

Optional fields:
- tagId: Unique tag identifier (auto-generated if not provided)
- meta: Additional metadata as JSON object

Tag types:
- item: Tag for individual items
- box: Tag for boxes/containers

After registration, attach the tag to an item by updating the item with the tag ID. Requires authentication.

Get details of a specific tag by its ID.

Returns:
- Tag ID and type
- Associated item (if attached)
- Metadata
- Creation timestamp

If the tag is attached to an item, the response includes full item details. Requires authentication.

query.description: Filter by tag type: item or box (optional)

request.description:
List all tags registered for the authenticated user's business.

Query parameters:
- type (optional): Filter by tag type (item or box)

Returns tags with their associated items (if attached), sorted by creation date (newest first). Requires authentication.

item.description: NFC/RFID tag management endpoints for registering and tracking tags

item.name: Alerts & Notifications

request.description:
Get inventory alerts for the authenticated user's business.

Query parameters:
- includeResolved (optional): Set to 'true' to include resolved alerts

Alert types:
- low_stock: Item quantity at or below threshold
- out_of_stock: Item quantity is zero
- expiry_warning: Item expiring within 7 days
- critical: High priority alerts

Severity levels:
- info: Informational
- warning: Warning level
- critical: Critical priority

Alerts include item details and are sorted by creation date (newest first). Requires authentication.

Manually resolve an alert. Only owners and admins can resolve alerts.

Once resolved, the alert:
- isResolved = true
- resolvedAt = current timestamp

Alerts also auto-resolve when the underlying issue is fixed (e.g., stock is replenished above threshold).

Requires authentication and owner/admin role.

Manually trigger a threshold check for all items and check for expiring items.

This endpoint runs:
1. Threshold check for all items (creates/resolves low stock alerts)
2. Expiry check for items expiring within 7 days

Useful for testing or forcing an immediate check outside the scheduled times.

Scheduled checks run automatically:
- Threshold checks: Every hour
- Expiry checks: Daily at 8:00 AM

Only owners and admins can trigger manual checks. Requires authentication.

Register a device for push notifications using Expo push tokens.

Required fields:
- token: Valid Expo push token (format: ExponentPushToken[...])
- platform: Device platform (ios, android, or web)

Optional fields:
- deviceId: Unique device identifier

After registration, the device will receive push notifications for:
- Low stock alerts
- Out of stock alerts
- Critical alerts
- Expiry warnings

Email notifications are sent only for critical alerts. In-app notifications are always created.

Requires authentication.

query.description: Maximum number of notifications to return (default: 50)

request.description:
Get notifications for the authenticated user.

Query parameters:
- limit (optional): Maximum number of notifications (default: 50)
- includeRead (optional): Set to 'true' to include read notifications

Returns:
- notifications: Array of notification objects
- unreadCount: Count of unread notifications

Notifications include:
- Title and message
- Type and severity
- Related alert and item data
- Delivery channels (push, email, in_app)
- Read status and timestamp

Requires authentication.

Get the count of unread notifications for the authenticated user.

Useful for displaying notification badges in the UI. Requires authentication.

Mark a specific notification as read.

Updates:
- isRead = true
- readAt = current timestamp

Requires authentication.

Mark all notifications as read for the authenticated user.

Returns the count of notifications marked as read. Requires authentication.

Delete a specific notification. Users can only delete their own notifications.

Requires authentication.

item.description: Alert management and notification system endpoints

item.name: Sync

request.description:
Push offline operations to the server for synchronization.

This endpoint processes multiple operations from offline clients and applies them to the server database.

Operation structure:
- opId: Unique operation ID (required, prevents duplicates)
- type: Operation type (adjust, create, update, delete)
- entityType: Entity being modified (item, tag, business)
- payload: Operation data
- clientTimestamp: When operation occurred on client (optional)

Operation types:
- adjust: Adjust item quantity
- create: Create new entity
- update: Update existing entity
- delete: Delete entity

Conflict resolution:
- Last-write-wins strategy
- Duplicate opId ignored
- Insufficient quantity returns conflict status
- Server timestamp checked for updates

Response includes:
- serverTime: Current server timestamp
- results: Array of operation results (applied, conflict, failed)

Use the serverTime for subsequent pull requests. Requires authentication.

Pull operations from the server that occurred after a specific timestamp.

Query parameters:
- since (required): ISO timestamp of last successful sync

Returns:
- serverTime: Current server timestamp (use for next pull)
- operations: Array of operations since the timestamp
- count: Number of operations

Use this endpoint to:
1. Fetch changes made by other users/devices
2. Keep local database synchronized
3. Resolve conflicts from push operations

Typical sync flow:
1. Pull latest changes (using last sync timestamp)
2. Apply changes to local database
3. Push local changes
4. Store new serverTime for next sync

Requires authentication.

query.description: Maximum number of conflicts to return (default: 100)

request.description:
Get a log of sync conflicts for the business.

Query parameters:
- limit (optional): Maximum number of conflicts (default: 100)

Returns conflicts with:
- Operation details
- Conflict reason (e.g., insufficient quantity, server has newer data)
- User who performed the operation
- Item details (if applicable)
- Timestamps

Useful for:
- Debugging sync issues
- Understanding why operations failed
- Auditing rejected changes

Requires authentication.

Remove duplicate sync operations based on opId.

This maintenance endpoint:
- Finds operations with duplicate opId
- Keeps the first occurrence
- Deletes duplicates
- Returns count of removed operations

Useful for cleaning up the sync operation log. Only owners and admins can run deduplication.

Requires authentication and owner/admin role.

query.description: Keep operations from last N days (default: 30)

request.description:
Delete old sync operations to free up database space.

Query parameters:
- days (optional): Number of days to keep (default: 30)

This maintenance endpoint:
- Deletes operations older than specified days
- Returns count of removed operations
- Keeps recent operations for sync

Recommended to run periodically (e.g., monthly) to maintain database performance.

Only owners and admins can run cleanup. Requires authentication.

Check sync service status and get current server time.

Returns:
- serverTime: Current server timestamp
- businessId: Authenticated user's business ID
- userId: Authenticated user ID
- message: Status message

Useful for:
- Verifying sync service is operational
- Getting accurate server time
- Confirming authentication

Requires authentication.

item.description: Offline synchronization endpoints for multi-device support and conflict resolution

item.name: Reports

query.description: Response format: json, csv, or pdf (default: json)

request.description:
Generate a comprehensive stock summary report.

Query parameters (all optional):
- from: Start date for events (YYYY-MM-DD)
- to: End date for events (YYYY-MM-DD)
- format: Response format (json, csv, pdf)

Report includes for each item:
- Item details (name, SKU, category)
- Current quantity and unit
- Minimum threshold
- Total added (restocking)
- Total removed (sold/used)
- Net change

Formats:
- json: Returns JSON array
- csv: Downloads CSV file
- pdf: Downloads formatted PDF

Requires authentication.

query.description: Response format: json, csv, or pdf (default: json)

request.description:
Generate a report of items with low stock (quantity <= minThreshold).

Query parameters:
- format (optional): Response format (json, csv, pdf)

Report includes:
- Item details (name, SKU, category)
- Current quantity
- Minimum threshold
- Unit
- Percentage remaining (calculated)

Items are sorted by quantity (lowest first).

Formats:
- json: Returns JSON array
- csv: Downloads CSV file
- pdf: Downloads formatted PDF

Requires authentication.

query.description: Response format: json, csv, or pdf (default: json)

request.description:
Generate usage trends report showing item activity over time.

Query parameters:
- period (required): Time period (weekly or monthly)
- format (optional): Response format (json, csv, pdf)

Period options:
- weekly: Last 12 weeks of data
- monthly: Last 12 months of data

Report includes for each item/period:
- Item name and ID
- Time period (e.g., 2025-W03 or 2025-01)
- Total added (restocking)
- Total sold
- Total used internally
- Total adjusted
- Net change

Useful for:
- Identifying usage patterns
- Forecasting stock needs
- Planning purchases

Formats:
- json: Returns JSON array
- csv: Downloads CSV file
- pdf: Downloads formatted PDF (landscape)

Requires authentication.

query.description: Number of top items to return (default: 10)
Response format: json or csv (default: json)

request.description:
Generate a report of top selling items.

Query parameters (all optional):
- limit: Number of items to return (default: 10)
- from: Start date for sales (YYYY-MM-DD)
- to: End date for sales (YYYY-MM-DD)
- format: Response format (json or csv)

Report includes:
- Item name and ID
- Total quantity sold
- Unit

Items are sorted by total sold (highest first).

Useful for:
- Identifying popular products
- Inventory planning
- Sales analysis

Formats:
- json: Returns JSON array
- csv: Downloads CSV file

Requires authentication.

Generate a breakdown of inventory by category.

Report includes for each category:
- Category name
- Number of items in category
- Total quantity across all items

Items without a category are grouped under "Uncategorized".

Categories are sorted by total quantity (highest first).

Useful for:
- Understanding inventory composition
- Identifying major product categories
- Planning category-specific actions

Returns JSON only. Requires authentication.

item.description: Reporting and analytics endpoints for business insights

item.name: Admin

query.description: Filter by status: pending, approved, rejected, suspended (optional)

request.description:
Get all businesses in the system. Admin only.

Query parameters:
- status (optional): Filter by business status

Status values:
- pending: Awaiting approval
- approved: Approved and active
- rejected: Application rejected
- suspended: Temporarily suspended

Returns businesses with approval details, sorted by creation date (newest first).

Requires authentication and admin role.

Approve a pending business application. Admin only.

This action:
- Changes status to 'approved'
- Records approving admin
- Sets approval timestamp

After approval, the business can operate normally.

Requires authentication and admin role.

Reject a business application. Admin only.

Optional fields:
- reason: Reason for rejection

This action:
- Changes status to 'rejected'
- Records rejection reason

The business owner can see the rejection reason and may reapply.

Requires authentication and admin role.

Suspend a business temporarily. Admin only.

Optional fields:
- reason: Reason for suspension

This action:
- Changes status to 'suspended'
- Records suspension reason
- Prevents business operations

Used for policy violations or investigation periods.

Requires authentication and admin role.

query.description: Filter by suspension status: true or false (optional)
Filter by role: owner, staff, admin (optional)

request.description:
Get all users in the system. Admin only.

Query parameters (all optional):
- suspended: Filter by suspension status (true/false)
- role: Filter by user role (owner, staff, admin)

Returns users with:
- Profile information
- Business details
- Suspension status and reason
- Suspending admin details

Excludes sensitive data (passwords, tokens).

Sorted by creation date (newest first). Requires authentication and admin role.

Suspend a user account. Admin only.

Optional fields:
- reason: Reason for suspension

This action:
- Marks user as suspended
- Records suspension reason and timestamp
- Records suspending admin
- Prevents user login

Notes:
- Cannot suspend admin users
- Suspended users cannot access the system

Requires authentication and admin role.

Remove suspension from a user account. Admin only.

This action:
- Removes suspended status
- Clears suspension reason and timestamps
- Allows user to login again

Requires authentication and admin role.

Get comprehensive system metrics and statistics. Admin only.

Returns metrics for:

Businesses:
- Total, active, pending, suspended counts

Users:
- Total, active, suspended counts

Inventory:
- Total items
- Items with tags
- Total tags
- Low stock items count

Alerts:
- Total alerts
- Unresolved alerts
- Critical alerts

Useful for:
- System monitoring
- Dashboard displays
- Health checks
- Capacity planning

Requires authentication and admin role.

item.description: Administrative endpoints for system management (admin role required)
